required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Treatment of Diabetic Macular Edema With 0.5mg Intraocular Ranibizumab (Lucentis)
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective, Non-randomized, Mono-center, Cohort Study of Evaluate the Effects of 0.5mg Intraocular Ranibizumab (Lucentis)Injections on Retinal Function in Patients With Diabetic Macular Edema (DME) During Twelve Months

brief_summary.textblock: In this prospective, open-label clinical study is to investigate the behavior of the retinal functions during development of diabetic macular disease (DME) under the influence of Lucentis. Measurements with the multifocal electroretinogram (ERG) and microperimetry is used here as an objective criteria to information about the retinal function obtain.

primary_outcome.measure: Main outcome measures are the changes of retinal function of the macula monitored by multifocal-ERG as measured 12 months
primary_outcome.description: Main outcome measures are the changes of retinal function of the macula monitored by multifocal-ERG as measured 12 months

secondary_outcome.measure: to document changes in best corrected visual acuity measured on 4 meters
secondary_outcome.description: to document changes in best corrected visual acuity measured on 4 meters

secondary_outcome.measure: to document changes in optical coherence tomography (OCT)
secondary_outcome.description: to document changes in optical coherence tomography (OCT)

intervention.description: Ranibizumab Short- and Log-term Effects on Retinal Function measured by Multifocal-ERG and Microperimetry

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. diabetic macular edema with center involvement in at least one eye
2. patients with a central retinal thickness
3. patients with a BCVA of 78-24 EDTRS letters
4. decrease in vision is due to DME and not due to other causes, in the opinion of the investigator
5. Type 1 or type 2 diabetes mellitus diagnosed 2 years prior to screening
Exclusion Criteria:
1. history or evidence of severe cardiac disease
2. clinical or medical history uncontrolled hypertension or diabetes
3. of unstable angina, acute coronary syndrome, myocardial infarction or revascularization with 6 months
4. ventricular tachyarrhythmias requiring ongoing treatment
5. history or evidence clinically significant peripheral vascular disease, such a intermittent claudication or prior amputation
6. clinically significant impaired renal or hepatic function

overall_official.affiliation: University of Luebeck - Department of Ophthalmology: Germany
